trans-unit.source: Provides the form adapter class for the XHTML mobile controls adapter set.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The control adapters in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters> namespace provide XHTML rendering and processing for mobile controls on a variety of display devices.
The XhtmlFormAdapter class provides the adapter for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlFormAdapter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Gets a reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form"></xref> object with which the adapter is associated.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form"></xref>.
Renders the page content on the client using the provided <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
Renders the pager user interface for the form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
Renders a pager tag on paginated forms.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter"></xref>.
The target page number.
The text to appear on the pager.
The access key for the tag.
